content:
Diagnosis
	1. Right breast large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	Enrolled in AKT-PREDICT trial - randomised to experimental arm
	Cycle 1-3 dose-dense EC completed March 2024
	Cycle 1-3 Paclitaxel with AKT inhibitor capivasertib commenced April 2024

	Clinical studies
	AKT-PREDICT Phase II trial - investigating addition of capivasertib to standard chemotherapy in AKT-positive breast cancer

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Grade 2 diarrhea, Grade 1 fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	I was very pleased to review [redacted name] today for assessment prior to cycle 4 of weekly paclitaxel with capivasertib on the AKT-PREDICT trial. She has shown remarkable resilience through her treatment journey. The initial dose-dense EC was well tolerated with only grade 1 nausea and minimal fatigue. Since starting paclitaxel with capivasertib, she has experienced intermittent diarrhea, currently grade 2, managed with loperamide as per trial protocol. Her fatigue remains grade 1 and she continues her daily walks, though at a reduced pace.

Her blood tests today show stable parameters with neutrophils 2.1, platelets 156, and normal liver function. Trial-mandated cardiac monitoring with recent echocardiogram shows preserved ejection fraction at 58%. Quality of life assessments completed today show slight improvement in fatigue scores compared to cycle 3.

She is coping well psychologically and feels supported by our research team. Her husband attended today and they both expressed appreciation for the regular monitoring and support provided through the trial.

	Further investigations
	Trial-mandated CT chest/abdomen/pelvis scheduled for after cycle 6
	Next echocardiogram due prior to cycle 6

	Medication prescribed
	Capivasertib 400mg BD, days 1-4 of each weekly paclitaxel
	Loperamide 2mg prn for diarrhea

	Follow up
	Weekly review during paclitaxel/capivasertib treatment
Next trial assessment visit scheduled for 15/5/24

	Required trial protocol actions
	Quality of life questionnaire completed
Adverse event log updated
Trial medication diary reviewed and collected
Next cycle drug dispensing arranged

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER positive, PR low, HER2 negative, AKT positive

cancer_timeline.value: Right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Enrolled in AKT-PREDICT trial - randomised to experimental arm
Started weekly paclitaxel with capivasertib (AKT inhibitor)

patient_facts.value: Echocardiogram shows preserved ejection fraction at 58%
Blood tests show neutrophils 2.1, platelets 156, normal liver function
Slight improvement in fatigue scores compared to cycle 3

status_updates.value: Right breast neuroendocrine carcinoma on AKT-PREDICT trial. Tolerating treatment well with manageable grade 2 diarrhea
Grade 2 diarrhea managed with loperamide as per trial protocol
Continuing weekly paclitaxel with capivasertib 400mg BD days 1-4
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis scheduled after cycle 6, echocardiogram due prior to cycle 6
Weekly review during treatment, next trial assessment 15/5/24
